100.name: Continue
100.use: Indicates that the initial request was received and the client should continue.

101.name: Switching Protocols
101.use: Informs the client that the server is switching protocols as requested.

201.name: Created
201.use: A new resource was successfully created.

204.name: No Content
204.use: The request was successful but there is no content to return.

301.name: Moved Permanently
301.use: The requested resource has been moved permanently to a new URL.

302.name: Found (Moved Temporarily)
302.use: The resource is temporarily available at a different URL.

304.name: Not Modified
304.use: Indicates the resource has not been modified since last request.

400.name: Bad Request
400.use: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax.

401.name: Unauthorized
401.use: Authentication is required to access the resource.

403.name: Forbidden
403.use: The client does not have permission to access the resource.

404.name: Not Found
404.use: The requested resource could not be found.

429.name: Too Many Requests
429.use: The client has sent too many requests in a given timeframe.

500.name: Internal Server Error
500.use: The server encountered an unexpected condition.

502.name: Bad Gateway
502.use: Received an invalid response from an upstream server.

503.name: Service Unavailable
503.use: The server is temporarily unable to handle the request.

504.name: Gateway Timeout
504.use: The server did not receive a timely response from an upstream server.
